description: This Notification is generated when the
RSVP module changes state
The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: When vRtrRsvpGeneralAdminState is set to 'inService', the agent
attempts to enable the RSVP protocol instance on this router.
When vRtrRsvpGeneralAdminState is set to 'outOfService', the
agent attempts to disable the RSVP protocol instance on this
router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-RSVP-MIB::vRtrRsvpGeneralAdminState

description: vRtrRsvpGeneralOperState indicates the current operating state
of this RSVP protocol instance on this router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-RSVP-MIB::vRtrRsvpGeneralOperState

description: This Notification is generated when a RSVP
interface changes state
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-RSVP-MIB::vRtrRsvpIfStateChange IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9 RSVP-MIB::rsvpIfEnabled i 1 TIMETRA-RSVP-MIB::vRtrRsvpIfOperState i 1

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: If TRUE, RSVP is enabled on this Interface.
If FALSE, RSVP is not enabled on this
interface.
variables.name: RSVP-MIB::rsvpIfEnabled

description: vRtrRsvpIfOperState indicates the current operating state
of the RSVP protocol on this interface. When the
TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfPortID object of this interface is set
to a loopback port identifier, the operational state is not relevant
and an SNMP GET request on this object will return 'unknown'.
variables.name: TIMETRA-RSVP-MIB::vRtrRsvpIfOperState

description: The vRtrRsvpIfNbrStateUp notification is
generated when a RSVP interface neighbor
changes to active state

event.Summary: RSVP interface neighbor changed to active state

description: The encapsulation being used by this
neighbor.
variables.name: RSVP-MIB::rsvpNbrProtocol

description: The vRtrRsvpIfNbrStateDown notification is
generated when a RSVP interface neighbor
changes to inactive state

event.Summary: RSVP interface neighbor changed to inactive state due to $v2

description: The encapsulation being used by this
neighbor.
variables.name: RSVP-MIB::rsvpNbrProtocol

description: Used by vRtrRsvpIfNbrStateDown notification,
vRtrRsvpIfNbrDownReasonCode specifies the reason
for a RSVP interface neighbor becoming inactive.
variables.name: TIMETRA-RSVP-MIB::vRtrRsvpIfNbrDownReasonCode

description: [CAUSE] The vRtrRsvpPEFailOverPriToStdBy notification is
raised when primary Provider Edge (PE) has switched over
to standby PE. The IP address of the primary PE can be
extracted from the vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEAddrType and
vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEAddr indexes of the varbinds in this
notification.
[EFFECT] The tunnel traffic may be affected.
[RECOVERY] None required.

event.Summary: Primary provider edge (PE) switched over to standby PE

description: The value of vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEStandbyAdrTyp specifies the type of
the address assigned to the standby PE indicated by
vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEStandbyAddr. This object MUST be specified at row
creation time.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-NG-MIB::vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEStandbyAdrTyp

description: The value of vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEStandbyAddr specifies the
value of the address assigned to a standby PE to be used in UMH
selection for MVPN source redundancy. This value cannot be modified
without shutting down the MVPN instance.
An address instance of 'vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEStandbyAddr' can be
associated with only a single address instance of
'vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEAddr' or in other words the pairing must be
unique.
This object MUST be specified at row creation time.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-NG-MIB::vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEStandbyAddr

description: Used by vRtrRsvpPEFailOverPriToStdBy notification.
vRtrRsvpPEFailOverReasonCode specifies the reason
for Provider Edge (PE) switch over.
variables.name: TIMETRA-RSVP-MIB::vRtrRsvpPEFailOverReasonCode

description: [CAUSE] The vRtrRsvpPEFailOverPriToStdBy notification is
raised when standby Provider Edge (PE) has switched over
to primary PE. The IP address of the primary PE can be
extracted from the vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEAddrType and
vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEAddr indexes of the varbinds in this
notification.
[EFFECT] The tunnel traffic may be affected.
[RECOVERY] None required.

event.Summary: Standby provider edge (PE) switched over to primary PE

description: The value of vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEStandbyAdrTyp specifies the type of
the address assigned to the standby PE indicated by
vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEStandbyAddr. This object MUST be specified at row
creation time.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-NG-MIB::vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEStandbyAdrTyp

description: The value of vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEStandbyAddr specifies the
value of the address assigned to a standby PE to be used in UMH
selection for MVPN source redundancy. This value cannot be modified
without shutting down the MVPN instance.
An address instance of 'vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEStandbyAddr' can be
associated with only a single address instance of
'vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEAddr' or in other words the pairing must be
unique.
This object MUST be specified at row creation time.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-NG-MIB::vRtrPimNgMvpnUMHPEStandbyAddr
